actions.text: Committee on Rules Granted a Rule Providing for Consideration in the House; Waiving all Points of Order Against Consideration of the Bill; Providing one Hour of Debate.
Rules Committee Resolution H.Res.317 Reported to House.

actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Ways and Means

actions.text: Called up by House by Rule.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

Committee on Finance requested executive comment from OMB, International Trade Commission, Office of the U.S. Trade Representative, Treasury Department, State Department, Commerce Department, Agriculture Department, Health and Human Services Department.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Ways and Means

official_title: A bill to extend until December 14, 1985, the application of certain tobacco excise taxes, trade adjustment assistance, certain medicare reimbursement provisions, and borrowing authority under the railroad unemployment insurance program.

summary.text: Extends the increase in the excise tax on cigarettes from November 15, 1985, to December 15, 1985. Extends from November 14, 1985, to December 14, 1985: (1) the trade adjustment assistance program; (2) borrowing authority under the Railroad Unemployment Insurance Act; and (3) Medicare hospital and physician payments.

titles.title: A bill to extend until December 14, 1985, the application of certain tobacco excise taxes, trade adjustment assistance, certain medicare reimbursement provisions, and borrowing authority under the railroad unemployment insurance program.
